title: Add --file and --glob flags to consoul ask/chat for file context
description:
**As a** Consoul user
**I want** to attach files via --file and --glob flags
**So that** I can provide code/config context to the AI without pasting

**Context:**
Documentation extensively shows --file and --glob usage but only --attach exists:

- Line 82-93: consoul chat --file main.py "Review this code"
- Line 99-103: consoul chat --glob "*.py" "What does this project do?"
- Multiple workflow examples rely on these flags

Currently only --attach exists (for images with vision models).
Need --file for text files and --glob for pattern matching.

**Proposed Implementation:**

Add --file and --glob flags to both commands:
- --file: Single file attachment (can be used multiple times)
- --glob: Pattern matching (e.g., "*.py", "src/**/*.ts")

Examples:
consoul ask --file app.py --file utils.py "How do these work together?"
consoul ask --glob "src/**/*.py" "Summarize the codebase"

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- --file flag reads and includes file content in message
- Multiple --file flags supported
- --glob expands pattern and includes all matching files
- Files included with clear delimiters/formatting
- Large file handling (truncation or error)
- Non-existent file shows helpful error
- Binary files detected and rejected gracefully
- Combining --file and --glob works correctly

**Story Points:** 3
